edu.biu.scapi.securityLevel

Interface Eav

  • All Superinterfaces:
    EncSecLevel, SecurityLevel
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    AsymAdditiveHomomorphicEnc, AsymmetricEnc, AsymMultiplicativeHomomorphicEnc, AuthenticatedEnc, CBCEnc, Cca1, Cca2, Cpa, CramerShoupDDHEnc, CTREnc, DamgardJurikEnc, ElGamalEnc, RSAOaepEnc, SymAdditiveHomomorphicEnc, SymmetricEnc, SymMultiplicativeHomomorphicEnc, TPBlumGoldWasserEnc
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BcRSAOaep, CramerShoupAbs, CryptoPPRSAOaep, ElGamalAbs, OpenSSLCBCEncRandomIV, OpenSSLCTREncRandomIV, OpenSSLEncWithIVAbs, OpenSSLRSAOaep, RSAOaepAbs, ScCBCEncRandomIV, ScCramerShoupDDHOnByteArray, ScCramerShoupDDHOnGroupElement, ScCTREncRandomIV, ScDamgardJurikEnc, ScElGamalKEM, ScElGamalOnByteArray, ScElGamalOnGroupElement, ScEncryptThenMac

    public interface Eav
extends EncSecLevel
    An encryption scheme that is only secure for eavesdropping adversaries (like a stream cipher) should implement this interface. It is also necessary to specify if such a scheme is Indistinguishable or NonMalleable.
    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Yael Ejgenberg)
